name: European Naiad

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: Small (rarely >3.5cm long, 0.3-.5mm wide), strap-shaped, pointed with distinctly serrated margins, arranged in opposite, sub-opposite, whorls or clumps
Flowers: small, inconspicuous, borne in leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: purplish, 2.5-3mm long, spindle shaped and slightly curved
Habitat: Prefers sand, gravel but can thrive in wide substrate range
Tolerant of turbidity and eutrophic conditions
Range: Northeast US Range: Maine, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Vermont, New York

tags: plants with blade-shaped leaves on stems
fine slender leaves - not arranged in whorls
